comment: Had 0 lectures about how to write a paper. You research a mock topic, but never write on it, then do the same thing on a final topic and write a 10-15 page paper on it. It's not the hardest class, but it does feel like I didn't really learn anything in it. Take advantage of work days (almost every class), and you'll do alright.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Easy A. LOTS OF READING. I was able to fond all my books online and all as audiobooks. Easy quizzes on each reading. You have two PowerPoint Presentations (midterm and final) both are the same. Come to class and engage to get the most out of the readings.  Lecture can be boring if no one participates.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class is 2 easy presentations, easy online quizzes, &participation. If you hate reading, u can take her. Class is mostly her chatting about broad topics w/ students opinions. I was scared she would fail me cause I'm shy &NEVER participate, but she has MUCH empathy; you must b attentive tho. May not respond to emails & cancel class without notice.

class is sooooooooo boring. always day dreaming. easy A. online quizzes, participation for coming to class and two project presentation(midterm and final) same thing, different story. if you are taking a hard class, i would suggest  taking this.
We never talked about English much less composition. I walked out of the class asking my self, "What did we just do for an hour and 15?". Waste of time. Waste of money. Easy A.

You have two projects (midterm and final) that are both the same. She offers extra bonus points if you go to shakespeares tavern and write a report on it. You have quizzes over all the books you read throughout the semester. Participation is important, but she usually just replies 'ok' to your contribution.

Really easy A. Just have to read the assigned books and take an online quiz once a week. Midterm and final were just projects, you just have to make a powerpoint. Also get graded for participating in her discussions. Tons of extra credit options! Only thing is she is kinda moody and she can't stay on topic. Would still take her again though!

Honestly my only complaint was that she had no concept of time. Online quizzes were due at the latest an hour before class started, but she wouldn't put the quiz online for us to take till almost 9 or 10 pm the night before. 2 quizzes per week. The midterm and final were exactly the same and super easy. All you had to do was read.

Professor Garrett's World Lit class is not very hard. You have a few books that you have to "read" and there are quizzes on the assigned reading due before class everyday. If you ever have a question outside of class do not expect an answer from her, she rarely e-mails you back. She does offer extra credit for going to plays in Atlanta. Easy class.

Okay, I gave this professor a 5.0  because its the easiest A you can make. However, quizzes before every class. Slow responder to emails. She is moody, not great at discussions. Waste of time learning wise. BUT so much extra credit, it would be hard NOT to get a A in this class. She cares about her students and their grades. I would take her again.
She is a very easy professor as long as you do what your supposed to. Read the s pass the online quizzes and their are NO TEST just 2 presentations that are easy and she ALOT OF EXTRACREDIT!!

She is a fairly good professor but was not a very good conversation starter for her classes. She gets annoyed if you are not "into" lots of fantasy literature. If you can find another professor I would.

This professor was phenomenal! She was very friendly and tried her best to help each and every student that needed help or didn't understand the material. Her midterm was very easy and her classes were never dull. I seriously recommend this professor!

Mrs. Garrett is a great professor. Her class discussions really help you understand the material. She is friendly and a great listener. However, she gives two test a midterm and final, and they are both very long. I would recommend this professor any day.

Not a horrible professor but not great.  If you can shop around for others, due it. From talking with my friends, I was the only one who had to write three 5-7 pages and a 15 page research paper. Other 1102 has you do one or the other NOT BOTH! She's alright if you can't find anything else, but like I said, shop around.

Prof Garrett is excellent! She's very friendly and will do anything to help you make a better grade. I originally thought the four 5-7 page exams were daunting, but they turned out to be relatively easy. Aced all of them. I'm not a big fan of some of the readings & in class group work, but its easy as long as you read. Grades easily on everything!
This teacher is amazing and has a lot of things that you do in this class makes it worth it. Had a lot of fun taking this teacher and she was amazing with the take home midterms and finals.

Easy class just do the 8 two page papers and don't worry about taking notes just read the books or spark notes if it helps. She gives plenty of extra credit and the two test were only a little difficult. Just be a good student and attend class and you will do just fine.

This professor is HORRIBLE. Do not take her if you can avoid it at all costs. She does not teach. The only thing she actually taught the class was not to plagiarize. She made the class teach everything with group projects, and she sits and watches. I did not learn a single thing, and I am paying for my education. Useless.

Professor Garrett is an awesome teacher! She is entertaining, helpful, and cares for her students. There is a 15 pager due at the end of the semester, but you have several months to write it. I highly recommend this class if you are an independent writer and a dedicated student...easy A if you are one :)

Mrs Garrett is the best! As long as you do the work and attend class, it is an easy A! Throughout the semester, we were set up in groups and had to present certain chapters that would have to last for 2 class periods. Besides that the work load is very manageable! Our final was a 15 page research paper, but she gives you 6 months to work on it!

Sweet. Reasonable. Helpful.  The only books that are really needed are Jacoubus and Ramage for the blogs.You won't miss much if you miss a class but attendance does affect your grade. Good grades on essays guaranteed if you go to the writing center or ask her for help. Not a hard course, but effort is required.

Do the essays. GO TO THE WRITING CENTER! That is her way of knowing that you put forth an effort. Not an "easy A" but revisions are offered. I did my essays, went to the center, did one revision and pulled an A. Very friendly and helpful. Do not be scared to ask questions. she loves those who participate

This professor is easy to deal with and is very willing to help her students. Read the material, write the essays, go to the writing center, go to class, don't be lazy and you'll probably do fine. You do have to get used to her teaching style though. She is not straightforward unless you ask, so ask questions and email her. Very friendly.

Her class isn't exactly "easy" but it isn't "hard" either. If you keep up with your discussion questions every week and turn in your papers every couple weeks it's really not that bad! She is extremely helpful and responds to emails quickly. She grades kind of hard, but she allows revisions!! I'd recommend this clss.

Really a good professor. If you do the work, you'll get along well with her. Not that hard, just a lot of material to keep up with. Regular discussion posts and a 5-7 page paper every few weeks. You use the text a lot and you have to do the readings to keep up with the discussion posts and write your papers.

She is not always in the best mood so it is important to know when to approach her.Class participation is very important to her so if you do not participate then be prepared to do some random ridiculous assignment. Papers are due every 2 weeks (5-7 pages). She assigns blogs about a chapter in the book that is also due every 2 weeks. Overall, great!

I love Ms. Garrett, she is very helpful. If you do the work and ask her to help you, you will do well. I though I was a horrible writer before this class but I listened to her and I got As on all my papers.
She's a hard grader, but if you go to her for help, she will help you.  I really liked that I was able to revise my essays.  The books were also really helpful, and I plan to keep them.

I had her fall '07 and I hated the class. She's very unclear with her directions and expectations but VERY clear that she plays favorites. She didn't like me because I had a different viewpoint than her in one of my papers and she took a grudge to me. I took my paper to other professors and they said I deserved at least a B. Garrett gave me an F.

My class was Fall06 on Sat & I really enjoyed it. She views writing as a process & you could rewrite your papers as many times as you needed. She's very opinionated and it was a writing arguments class so you were expected to give a good argument. She did seem to play favorites but I've yet to meet a prof that doesn't.

I had this prof in Fall06 for Sat classes & I really enjoyed the class. She views writing as a process & you could rewrite your papers as many times as you needed until you got the grade you wanted. She's very opinionated and it was a writing argrments class so you were expected to give a good argument. She did seem to play favs but I was one so...

she is a terrible teacher who does not tell us what she wants in the essays, then tells us we are wrong. she has flat out called a few students ignorant because they have different religious beliefs or different political views. she is closed minded cold and quite short with her students.
